actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend title 28 of the United States Code to prohibit any person from raising as a defense in a proceeding brought for an alleged violation of an antitrust law or the Civil Rights Act of 1964 that such persons was compelled by the law of a foreign state to take the action constituting the alleged violation.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Anti-Foreign Compulsion Act - Prohibits a person from raising as a defense in any proceeding in a Federal court for an alleged violation of an antitrust law or the Civil Rights Act of 1964, that such person was under compulsion by a foreign state to take the action constituting the alleged violation.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 28 of the United States Code to prohibit any person from raising as a defense in a proceeding brought for an alleged violation of an antitrust law or the Civil Rights Act of 1964 that such persons was compelled by the law of a foreign state to take the action constituting the alleged violation.
